dtliExcerpt: Rereading my scathing review in light of what is obviously a rave today, I am forced to grapple with my own past, and the playâ€™s. It would be easy to say that the difference between then and now is the heavy rewriting Jacobs-Jenkins has done in the interim. And certainly, comparing the two scripts, I see the clearer dramatic architecture and sharper point-of-view that a playwright in his prime, at 38, can impose.
